name: Outside a Log Cabin in the Forest
description: You're standing outside a fenced-in yard surrounding a sturdily-built log cabin in a clearing in the dense forest. There's a gate in the wooden fence which is currently open. Inside the fence is a small garden with two wet wooden buckets sitting next to it. A well-worn trail leads to the east. To the west is the cabin.

look: It's a well-worn dirt trail. It must see frequent traffic since there's hardly any weeds or grass growing.

features.roomDesc: There's an older man standing at the fence. It looks like he's trying to repair it.
look: He's an older man with white hair and a neatly trimmed white beard. With one hand he's holding a new board up to the fence and in the other he's holding a hammer. He's grumbling to himself. "How does this sort of thing always happen? One single nail short of finishing the job."
greet: The man turns toward you. "Oh, hello there! The name's Arden. Sorry, I can't talk now, I have to finish this fence. You wouldn't happen to have any nails on you, would you?"

args: "What's that? I asked if you have any nails on you. Do you?"
"Oh, what an amazing coincidence that you happen to have exactly one nail on you. If you don't mind, please give it to me."
"Now listen here, young'un! I've seen a few nails in my day and I can tell quite plainly that you don't have any on you."

no: "Well that's a shame. If you find any, I'd really appreciate one."

NAIL: "I really appreciate this!" Arden takes the nail, turns back to the fence and in just a few quick strikes finishes the repairs on the fence.
